Programs such as these help to supplement Americans‚Äô diets by distributing American-grown foods to seniors, low-income families, and those living on Tribal lands.

The Micro-Grants for Food Security Program (MGFSP) assists ag agencies and depts. to increase the production of locally grown food in food insecure communities. By investing in gardening, herding, and livestock operations, #MGFSP helps lay the groundwork to feed communities.

The Healthy Fluid Milk Incentive Projects (HFMI) is a pilot program that was launched last year to encourage #SNAP recipients to purchase milk by providing coupons for free milk after their initial purchase.

Community Food Projects (CFP)¬†grants help eligible nonprofit entities establish and carry out projects that improve access to locally produced food for low-income households. Since 2017, CFP has funded nearly 100 projects and distributed $23 million+ to increase food security.

The Healthy Food Financing Initiative (HFFI)¬†provides grants & tax credits to support the development of food retail locations in food deserts & underserved communities to improve access to healthy foods, create & preserve quality jobs, & revitalize low-income communities.

The Seniors Farmers' Market Nutrition Program (SFMNP)¬†awards grants to provide approx. 725,000 low-income seniors with coupons that can be exchanged for eligible foods at farmers‚Äô markets, roadside stands, and community supported agriculture programs.

The Gus Schumacher Nutrition Incentive Program (GusNIP)¬†provides Federal funding for projects that incentivize #SNAP participants‚Äô purchase of fruits and vegetables and produce ‚Äúprescriptions‚Äù for them,¬†giving families more access to healthy food options.

The¬†Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations (FDPIR) provides approx. 75,000 participants Federally purchased foods in lieu of #SNAP benefits¬†because Tribal lands and areas around them often don‚Äôt have easy access to SNAP offices or stores accepting SNAP benefits.

The Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP) provides monthly supplemental food packages to primarily low-income elderly persons, supplementing nutrients typically lacking in older persons‚Äô diets. In 2021, CSFP had approximately 661,100 participants per month.

The Emergency Food Assistance Program (TEFAP) is a Federal food distribution program that supports emergency feeding organizations like food banks. In 2020, #TEFAP supplied 2.2 billion pounds of Federally purchased foods to emergency food providers.
Nutrition programs are a vital part of the #FarmBill. You‚Äôre probably familiar with #SNAP, but did you know that there are many other nutrition programs in the farm bill?

.@RepJohnYarmuth: There is a lot to learn from the Rescue Plan and the important role the federal government can play in the lives of Americans. I look forward to discussing this further with our esteemed panel of witnesses today.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: We saved our economy and we delivered lifesaving and life-changing relief to families across the country, all while fueling the most equitable and impressive economic recovery in recent memory.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: But unlike our global counterparts, America is in a better place to face these economic headwinds because of the American Rescue Plan. We have avoided the grim forecasts CBO projected before the Rescue Plan.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: These are global challenges, which is why inflation is a global issue. As @SecYellen said last week, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre seeing high inflation in almost all of the developed countries around the world. And they have very different fiscal policies.‚Äù

.@RepJohnYarmuth: We have made significant progress, but now inflation is a challenge. Experts across the ideological spectrum agree that the main drivers of current inflation are international supply chain issues and energy price hikes caused by Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: In fact, the U.S. had the fastest economic recovery among the G-7 countries ‚Äì and our economy is projected to be larger at the end of this year ‚Äî relative to its pre-pandemic size ‚Äî than any other G-7 economy.
.@RepJohnYarmuth: Not only was the Rescue Plan more effective than other aid packages during the previous recession, but it also helped the United States recover more quickly than other nations.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: The law was also enormously beneficial to state and local governments. Funding from the Rescue Plan helped state and local governments avoid massive layoffs ‚Äì keeping teachers, firefighters, police, and millions of other essential workers on the job.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: Across-the-board, the data shows that the Rescue Plan helped American families enormously, ensuring they could put food on the table, stay in their homes, and avoid economic devastation despite the turbulent times.
.@RepJohnYarmuth: Despite the economic fallout of the pandemic and the possibility of a wave of evictions, foreclosures hit an all-time low last year.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: And it‚Äôs not only jobs. Incomes are up too by more than 5 percent overall, and by nearly 12% for the lowest-earning workers ‚Äî that‚Äôs even after accounting for inflation. The child poverty rate dropped nearly 40% from 2020 to 2021.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: In fact, the Rescue Plan nearly doubled GDP growth and led to the creation of 4 million additional jobs in 2021 ‚Äî that‚Äôs millions of Americans earning a paycheck as a direct result of the Rescue Plan.
.@RepJohnYarmuth: Seventeen states ‚Äî including my home state of Kentucky ‚Äî are seeing their lowest unemployment rates on record.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: On the jobs front ‚Äî before the Rescue Plan, the nonpartisan @USCBO projected our unemployment rate would be 5% right now, and that it wouldn‚Äôt drop below 4% within this decade. Thanks to the Rescue Plan, unemployment is near historic lows, at 3.6%.
.@RepJohnYarmuth: In 2021, the Rescue Plan powered the strongest economic growth in nearly 40 years, helping to improve our fiscal standing and laying the foundation for our record-breaking recovery.
.@RepJohnYarmuth: But they have also been subjected to a lot of misinformation about the law, so today, I want to start by laying out the facts.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: This legislation, which I was proud to sponsor, was signed into law 15 months ago. A lot has changed since then and the American people have benefitted enormously from the provisions of this law.
